a:r.a:t: Memory Corruption/Disclosure (_MEM) class type – Bugs/weaknesses allowing a memory corruption/disclosure exploit.
Memory Use (MUS) class – An object is initialized, read, written, or cleared improperly.
Read operation – Use the value of an object's data.
Address Fault/Error type – The object address in use is wrong.
Under Bounds Pointer fault/error – Holds an address below the lower boundary of its object.
Memory Corruption/Disclosure exploitable error type – An exploitable or undefined system behavior caused by memory addressing, allocation, use, and deallocation bugs.
Buffer Under-Read exploitable error – Reading below the lower bound of an object.
Bugs Framework (), BFCWE Tool, I. Bojanova, 2024
